original: @10a * // brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po dbyangs can by'a ka ra na'i 'grel ba rab tu bya ba gsal ldan zhes bya ba bzhugs so /
analyzed: @10a * // brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po dbyangs can by'a ka ra na'i 'grel ba rab tu bya ba gsal ldan zhes bya ba bzhugs so /
translated: The commentary on the great grammar treatise Sarasvatavyākaraṇa called Prakriyākaumudī.🔽The eye of all grammarians,

original: @10b (` // brda sprod smra ba yongs kyi mig / bram ze ba la bha drar grags//) # //
analyzed: @10b (` // brda sprod smra ba yongs kyi mig / bram ze ba la bha drar grags//) # //
translated: known as the brahmin Balabhadra.

original: aom sva sti bra dza bhya: bla ma dang ngag gi dbang phyug 'phags ma dbyangs can ma la sgo gsum gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: aom sva sti bra dza bhya: bla ma dang ngag gi dbang phyug 'phags ma dbyangs can ma la sgo gsum gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Om. May there be peace. With devotion of the three doors, I pay homage to the guru, the noble goddess Sarasvatī, the lady of speech.

original: zab yangs mkhyen brtse'i 'od zer brgya phrag gis //
analyzed: zab yangs mkhyen brtse'i 'od zer brgya phrag gis //
translated: With hundreds of rays of profound and vast knowledge and love,

original: bstan 'gro'i phan bde chu skyes gzhon nu'i tshal //
analyzed: bstan 'gro'i phan bde chu skyes gzhon nu'i tshal //
translated: the youthful garden of the lotus of benefit and happiness for the teachings and beings,

original: legs byas 'dzum dkar phyogs bcur bzhad pa'i gnyen //
analyzed: legs byas 'dzum dkar phyogs bcur bzhad pa'i gnyen //
translated: the friend who smiles with the white light of good deeds in the ten directions,

original: rnam 'dren phyag na padmas dge legs stsol //
analyzed: rnam 'dren phyag na padmas dge legs stsol //
translated: may the lotus-handed guide bestow virtue and excellence.

original: mtha' yas shes bya'i chu gter las 'khrungs shing //
analyzed: mtha' yas shes bya'i chu gter las 'khrungs shing //
translated: Born from the ocean of infinite objects of knowledge,

original: rnam dpyod ngag gi dpal ster lhag pa'i lha //
analyzed: rnam dpyod ngag gi dpal ster lhag pa'i lha //
translated: the supreme deity who bestows the glory of discernment and speech,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma'i thugs rje'i 'od dkar gyis //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma'i thugs rje'i 'od dkar gyis //
translated: may the white light of compassion of the Blessed Lady

original: bdag blo'i autpal rab tu rgyas par mdzod //
analyzed: bdag blo'i autpal rab tu rgyas par mdzod //
translated: May my lotus-like mind fully blossom.

original: tshul 'di rtogs na shes bya'i gnas kun la //
analyzed: tshul 'di rtogs na shes bya'i gnas kun la //
translated: If one understands this method,

original: thogs pa med pa bde blag bgrod pa'i lam //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa bde blag bgrod pa'i lam //
translated: One will easily traverse the unobstructed path🔽To all the topics of knowledge.🔽It is fitting to enter this text, the pure grammar,

original: bcu phrag rig gnas kun gyi dang po mchog / rnam dag brda sprod gzhung 'dir 'jug par rigs //
analyzed: bcu phrag rig gnas kun gyi dang po mchog / rnam dag brda sprod gzhung 'dir 'jug par rigs //
translated: The supreme and foremost of the ten fields of knowledge.

original: de yang 'dir brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po dbyangs can bya ka ran zhes bya ba 'phags ma dbyangs can mas slob dpon chen po aa nu bh'u ti la dngos su stsal ba'i gzhung /
analyzed: de yang 'dir brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po dbyangs can bya ka ran zhes bya ba 'phags ma dbyangs can mas slob dpon chen po aa nu bh'u ti la dngos su stsal ba'i gzhung /
translated: Moreover, here one should enter this very text, the great treatise on grammar, the Sanskrit Grammar of Sarasvatī, which was directly bestowed by the noble goddess Sarasvatī upon the great master Anubhūti,

original: 'grel ba slob dpon de nyid kyis (` //🔽snga na med pa'i legs bshad kyis //
analyzed: 'grel ba slob dpon de nyid kyis (` // snga na med pa'i legs bshad kyis //
translated: Along with the commentary composed by that very master,

original: gangs khrod snang byed 'dar lo ts'a//) @11a * //🔽mdzad pa dang bcas pa 'di nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: gangs khrod snang byed 'dar lo ts'a//) @11a * // mdzad pa dang bcas pa 'di nyid la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Which illuminates the snowy land with unprecedented eloquence.

original: rgya gar skad du /🔽sva ra sva sti by'a ka ra na s'u tra: bod skad du /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du / sva ra sva sti by'a ka ra na s'u tra: bod skad du /
translated: In the Indian language:🔽Svarasvatīvyākaraṇasūtra🔽In the Tibetan language:

original: brda sprod pa dbyangs can gyi mdo /
analyzed: brda sprod pa dbyangs can gyi mdo /
translated: The Sūtra of Sarasvatī's Grammar

original: 'phags ma dbyangs can ma la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽pra na mya pa ra m'atm'a nam b'a la dh'i priddhi siddha ye //🔽s'a ra sva st'i mri dzum kurbe pra kri yam n'a ti bi sta ram //
analyzed: 'phags ma dbyangs can ma la phyag 'tshal lo // pra na mya pa ra m'atm'a nam b'a la dh'i priddhi siddha ye // s'a ra sva st'i mri dzum kurbe pra kri yam n'a ti bi sta ram //
translated: Homage to the noble Sarasvatī.

original: mchog gi bdag nyid la ni rab btud de //
analyzed: mchog gi bdag nyid la ni rab btud de //
translated: I bow to the supreme self, the accomplished one, the power of speech,🔽May she bring forth the smile of the true nature, and accomplish the work of the world.

original: byis pa'i blo gros 'phel bar bsgrub pa'i phyir //🔽mtsho ldan mas mdzad rab tu bya ba rnams //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo gros 'phel bar bsgrub pa'i phyir // mtsho ldan mas mdzad rab tu bya ba rnams //
translated: In order to increase the intelligence of the childish,🔽I shall compose a practical treatise,

original: shin tu rgyas min go bder brtsam par bya //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas min go bder brtsam par bya //
translated: not too extensive, easy to understand,

original: aindra do nya pi ya sy'antam na ya yu: shabda b'a ra dhi: pra kri y'am ta sya kri tsha sya ksha mo b'a ktum na ra: ka tham //🔽gang zhig sgra yi chu gter dag gi mtha' //
analyzed: aindra do nya pi ya sy'antam na ya yu: shabda b'a ra dhi: pra kri y'am ta sya kri tsha sya ksha mo b'a ktum na ra: ka tham // gang zhig sgra yi chu gter dag gi mtha' //
translated: of the works composed by the ocean-like [Sarasvatī].🔽Even Indra and others were not able to fathom

original: dbang po la sogs kyis kyang ma spobs pa'i //🔽de yi rab tu bya ba rdzogs par ni //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs kyis kyang ma spobs pa'i // de yi rab tu bya ba rdzogs par ni //
translated: the extent of the ocean of words🔽of that sage,

original: mi yis brjod par bya ba ji ltar bzod //
analyzed: mi yis brjod par bya ba ji ltar bzod //
translated: how can a human being be capable of describing it completely?

original: de la yang thog mar yi ge so so'i ming dang brdam bshad na /
analyzed: de la yang thog mar yi ge so so'i ming dang brdam bshad na /
translated: Now, first of all, if the names and symbols of each letter are explained,

original: phyis gzhung mangs skyon dang rtogs dka' ba dang / brjod mi bde bas mtshams sbyor gyi thog mar ming dang brda gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: phyis gzhung mangs skyon dang rtogs dka' ba dang / brjod mi bde bas mtshams sbyor gyi thog mar ming dang brda gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Later, because of the fault of the text being too long, difficult to understand, and hard to express, I will set forth the names and symbols at the beginning of the commentary.🔽a ai au ri li sa ma na

original: aa ai au ri li sa m'a n'a: aa ai au ri li mchungs pha rnams so //
analyzed: aa ai au ri li sa m'a n'a: aa ai au ri li mchungs pha rnams so //
translated: a ā i ī u ū ri rī li lī

original: yi ge de rnams la mtshungs pa zhes chos 'byung ba'i phyir du ming du btags so //
analyzed: yi ge de rnams la mtshungs pa zhes chos 'byung ba'i phyir du ming du btags so //
translated: Those letters are called “similar” because they arise from the same source.

original: hra sva d'irgha plu ta bhe d'a: sa @11b barna: thung du ring po plu tas phye ba rnams 'dra ba'o //🔽aa sogs mtshungs pa'i yi ge de rnams la aa a'a aanya lta bu thung du ring bo plu ta ste yun tshad kyi dbye bas gsum gsum du yod do //
analyzed: hra sva d'irgha plu ta bhe d'a: sa @11b barna: thung du ring po plu tas phye ba rnams 'dra ba'o // aa sogs mtshungs pa'i yi ge de rnams la aa a'a aanya lta bu thung du ring bo plu ta ste yun tshad kyi dbye bas gsum gsum du yod do //
translated: ha sa va ra ya la śa🔽sa ta🔽Those letters are similar because they are divided by pluta.

original: lo k'atstshe sha sya siddhi ri ti bakshya ti /
analyzed: lo k'atstshe sha sya siddhi ri ti bakshya ti /
translated: Those similar letters, such as a, ā, aṃ, and so on, have three divisions by the measure of length: short, long, and pluta.

original: lhag ma 'jig rten las grub pa 'dir bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma 'jig rten las grub pa 'dir bshad do //
translated: The remaining ones are established in the world.🔽The remaining ones are established in the world.

original: ring thung gi tshad sogs gzhung 'dir dngos sum bshad pa'i lhag ma 'jig rten dang bstan bcos rnams la grags shing grub pa rnams kyang 'dir bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ring thung gi tshad sogs gzhung 'dir dngos sum bshad pa'i lhag ma 'jig rten dang bstan bcos rnams la grags shing grub pa rnams kyang 'dir bshad par bya'o //
translated: The remaining [measures] are known and established in the world and treatises, such as the measure of long and short, which are not explicitly explained in this treatise, and should be explained here.🔽Moreover,🔽The duration of one is short,

original: de yang / gcig gi yun tshad thung du dang // gnyis kyi yun tshad ring po ste //
analyzed: de yang / gcig gi yun tshad thung du dang // gnyis kyi yun tshad ring po ste //
translated: the duration of two is long,

original: gsum gyi yun tshad plu ta //
analyzed: gsum gyi yun tshad plu ta //
translated: the duration of three is pluta,

original: phyed kyi yun tshad gsal byed do //
analyzed: phyed kyi yun tshad gsal byed do //
translated: and the duration of half is clear.

original: de rnams re re la yang /
analyzed: de rnams re re la yang /
translated: And each of those

original: sgra skad gsangs mthon por 'don pa au d'atta dang / bar bar 'don pa sva ri ta dang / dma' bar 'don pa aa nu d'atta ste gsum gsum yod do //🔽ae aee ao aoo sandhya ksha r'a ni /
analyzed: sgra skad gsangs mthon por 'don pa au d'atta dang / bar bar 'don pa sva ri ta dang / dma' bar 'don pa aa nu d'atta ste gsum gsum yod do // ae aee ao aoo sandhya ksha r'a ni /
translated: has three: high-pitched sound, medium-pitched sound, and low-pitched sound.🔽Ai ai o o are the conjuncts.

original: ae aee ao aoo mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: ae aee ao aoo mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge rnams so //
translated: Ai ai o o are the conjuncts.

original: yi ge de rnams la mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge zhes bya ste thung du med pa'i ring po dang shin tu ring po nyid do //
analyzed: yi ge de rnams la mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge zhes bya ste thung du med pa'i ring po dang shin tu ring po nyid do //
translated: Those letters are called conjuncts, because they are long and very long without being short.

original: au bha yo sva r'a: gnyis po rnams dbyangs so //
analyzed: au bha yo sva r'a: gnyis po rnams dbyangs so //
translated: The vowels are the two groups of five and four.

original: aa yig la sogs pa la lnga dang ae yig la sogs pa bzhi po rnams la dbyangs zhes brjod par bya'o //🔽aa bardza n'a min: aa bor ba n'a mi'o //
analyzed: aa yig la sogs pa la lnga dang ae yig la sogs pa bzhi po rnams la dbyangs zhes brjod par bya'o // aa bardza n'a min: aa bor ba n'a mi'o //
translated: The five beginning with a and the four beginning with i are called vowels.🔽The vowels without a are called nā.

original: aa yig bor ba'i dbyangs rnams la n'a mi zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aa yig bor ba'i dbyangs rnams la n'a mi zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The vowels without the letter a are called nā.

original: de ltar dbyangs rnams kyi brda chad bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbyangs rnams kyi brda chad bshad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the convention of the vowels,

original: da ni gsal byed rnams kyi brda chad brjod par bya ste /🔽ha ya wa ra la nya na na nga ma dzha dha ngha gha bha dza da da ga ba kha pha tsha tha tha tsa ta ta ka ba sha sha s'a dyam t'a bhy'am /🔽ha ya wa ra la /🔽nya na na nga ma /🔽dzha dha ngha gha bha /
analyzed: da ni gsal byed rnams kyi brda chad brjod par bya ste / ha ya wa ra la nya na na nga ma dzha dha ngha gha bha dza da da ga ba kha pha tsha tha tha tsa ta ta ka ba sha sha s'a dyam t'a bhy'am / ha ya wa ra la / nya na na nga ma / dzha dha ngha gha bha /
translated: now the convention of the consonants will be stated.

original: dza da da ga ba /🔽kha pha tsha tha tha /🔽tsa ta ta ka pa /🔽sha sha sa thog ma dang mtha' ma dag gis so //
analyzed: dza da da ga ba /🔽kha pha tsha tha tha /🔽tsa ta ta ka pa /🔽sha sha sa thog ma dang mtha' ma dag gis so //
translated: Ha ya wa ra la nya na ṅa ña ṇa ña ḍa ḍha ṇa ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa ta ṭha ta ṭha pa pha ba bha ya ra la va śa ṣa sa ha kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa kṣa k

original: thog ma'i yi ge dang mtha'i yi ge brjod pas de gnyis kyi bar gyi yi ge rnams go bar byed de /
analyzed: thog ma'i yi ge dang mtha'i yi ge brjod pas de gnyis kyi bar gyi yi ge rnams go bar byed de /
translated: The initial and final letters express the letters in between.

original: de yang / ha sa zhes pa'i gsal byed yongs rdzogs dang / aa yig la sogs pa'i mthar ha sa bzhag pas /
analyzed: de yang / ha sa zhes pa'i gsal byed yongs rdzogs dang / aa yig la sogs pa'i mthar ha sa bzhag pas /
translated: The complete consonants are called hāsa, and hāsa is placed at the end of the vowels a and so on.🔽a i u r i l e ai o au

original: aa ai au ri li ae aee ao aoo /🔽ha ya wa ra la /
analyzed: aa ai au ri li ae aee ao aoo / ha ya wa ra la /
translated: hā ya va ra la

original: nya na na nga ma /🔽dzha dha dha gha bha /
analyzed: nya na na nga ma / dzha dha dha gha bha /
translated: nyana na ṅa ma🔽jha dha dha gha bha

original: dza da da ga ba /
analyzed: dza da da ga ba /
translated: ja da da ga

original: zhes pa rnams la aa ba so sor bsdu ba /🔽tsa ta ta ga ba rnams la tsa ba so sor bsdu ba /🔽@12a * // dzha dha dha gha ngha rnams la dzha bha so sor bsdu ba /
analyzed: zhes pa rnams la aa ba so sor bsdu ba / tsa ta ta ga ba rnams la tsa ba so sor bsdu ba / @12a * // dzha dha dha gha ngha rnams la dzha bha so sor bsdu ba /
translated: The vowels are individually combined with those.🔽The consonants are individually combined with ca ta ta ga ba.

original: dza da da ga ba rnams la dza ba so sor bsdu ba zhes pa lta bu /
analyzed: dza da da ga ba rnams la dza ba so sor bsdu ba zhes pa lta bu /
translated: The consonants are individually combined with jha dha dha gha ṅha.🔽The consonants are individually combined with ja da da ga ba.

original: thog ma'i yi ge la mtha' ma'i yi ge sbyar ba gang dang gang byung ba'i skabs su de dang de'i bar gyi yi ge rnams gzung bar bya'o //🔽ha s'a byanydza n'a ni /
analyzed: thog ma'i yi ge la mtha' ma'i yi ge sbyar ba gang dang gang byung ba'i skabs su de dang de'i bar gyi yi ge rnams gzung bar bya'o // ha s'a byanydza n'a ni /
translated: The initial and final letters are combined.

original: ha sa gsal byed rnams so //
analyzed: ha sa gsal byed rnams so //
translated: The consonants are hāsa.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar thog ma'i ha yig dang mtha' ma'i sa yig smos pas de'i bar gyi yi ge rnams go bas gsal byed la ha sa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar thog ma'i ha yig dang mtha' ma'i sa yig smos pas de'i bar gyi yi ge rnams go bas gsal byed la ha sa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: As explained above, the initial letter ha and the final letter sa are mentioned, and the letters in between are understood, so the consonants are called ha-sa.

original: sva ra hi nam byanydza nam /
analyzed: sva ra hi nam byanydza nam /
translated: Svarahinam vyañjanam.

original: dbyangs nyams pa gsal byed do //
analyzed: dbyangs nyams pa gsal byed do //
translated: The vowels are defective, the consonants are not.

original: ha sa so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge dbyangs med kho na la gsal byed zer ro //
analyzed: ha sa so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge dbyangs med kho na la gsal byed zer ro //
translated: The ha-sa, when they are collected individually, are called consonants, only without the vowels.

original: k'ar++y'a ye ta /
analyzed: k'ar++y'a ye ta /
translated: Karyaye ta.

original: bya ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i ched du'o //
translated: For the purpose of action.

original: ha sa rnams la srog tu aa yig zhugs pa ni kha nas brjod bde bar bya ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: ha sa rnams la srog tu aa yig zhugs pa ni kha nas brjod bde bar bya ba'i ched du'o //
translated: The letter a, which is the life of the ha-sa, is for the purpose of making it easy to pronounce from the mouth.🔽Yasye ta samjñātasya lopaḥ.

original: ya sye ta sam dzny'a ta sya lo pa: gang zhig aita kyi ming can de ni dbyi'o //
analyzed: ya sye ta sam dzny'a ta sya lo pa: gang zhig aita kyi ming can de ni dbyi'o //
translated: That which is called ita, that is the vowel.

original: rkyen dang dbyings sogs gang la yang rjes 'brel dbyi ba de la ai ta kyi ming can zhes zer te de ni dbyi'o //
analyzed: rkyen dang dbyings sogs gang la yang rjes 'brel dbyi ba de la ai ta kyi ming can zhes zer te de ni dbyi'o //
translated: That which is called ita, which is the vowel, is that to which the suffix i is added to any word, such as a condition, a vowel, etc.🔽Barnādarśane lopaḥ.

original: barn'a darsha nam lo pa: yi ge mi mthong ba phyis pa'o //
analyzed: barn'a darsha nam lo pa: yi ge mi mthong ba phyis pa'o //
translated: The non-seeing of the letter is the deletion.

original: barna bi ro dho lo pa sha / yi ge rnam par 'gog pa ni dbyi ba tsam mo /🔽mi tra ba t'a ga ma /
analyzed: barna bi ro dho lo pa sha / yi ge rnam par 'gog pa ni dbyi ba tsam mo / mi tra ba t'a ga ma /
translated: Varniruddha is the mere exclusion of a letter.🔽Mitrabhāgamam.

original: gnyen dang 'dra ba ni a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: gnyen dang 'dra ba ni a'a ga ma'o //
translated: Mitra is like a friend.

original: sha tru ba d'a de sha: dgra dang 'dra ba ni kun nas bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: sha tru ba d'a de sha: dgra dang 'dra ba ni kun nas bsgyur ba'o //
translated: Śatruvadādeśaḥ. Śatru is like an enemy.

original: sva r'a nam ta ri t'a ha s'a: sam yo ga: dbyangs par na med pa'i ha sa rnams ni yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sva r'a nam ta ri t'a ha s'a: sam yo ga: dbyangs par na med pa'i ha sa rnams ni yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Svarānam taritāhasāḥ saṃyogaḥ. Svarānam means the ha-s without svarita.

original: dbyangs par na med pa'i ha sa gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa brtsegs pa de la yang dag par sbyor ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyangs par na med pa'i ha sa gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa brtsegs pa de la yang dag par sbyor ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The two or three or more svarānam ha-s that are stacked up are called saṃyoga.

original: ku tsu tu tu pu barg'a: ku tsu tu tu pu sde ba rnams so //
analyzed: ku tsu tu tu pu barg'a: ku tsu tu tu pu sde ba rnams so //
translated: Kucuṭutupurvagāḥ kucuṭutupusamāḥ. Kucuṭutupusamāḥ are the groups.

original: ku zhes pas ka sde go ba lta bu au yig srog tu zhugs pas rang rang gi sde pa'i yi ge lnga po yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: ku zhes pas ka sde go ba lta bu au yig srog tu zhugs pas rang rang gi sde pa'i yi ge lnga po yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i don no //
translated: Like the ka-group is understood by ku, the meaning of the five letters of each group is to be taken by the entry of the u vowel into the life-force.

original: aa re do n'a mi no gu na: aar ae tra ao n'a mi'i yon tan no //
analyzed: aa re do n'a mi no gu na: aar ae tra ao n'a mi'i yon tan no //
translated: Arer donāminogunāḥ. Arer donāmi is a quality.

original: n'a mi'i yi ge rnams kyi nang nas aar aetra ao ste yon tan gyi yi ge rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: n'a mi'i yi ge rnams kyi nang nas aar aetra ao ste yon tan gyi yi ge rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: From among the letters of the nā class, the letters of the quality class, namely, ar, ai, o, come forth.

original: a'a ree aoo priddhi: a'a a'ara\ aee aoo 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: a'a ree aoo priddhi: a'a a'ara\ aee aoo 'phel ba'o //
translated: The letters ā, ai, au, pṛddhiḥ, ā, āri, ai, au are the augment letters.🔽ā āri ai

original: a'a a'ara\/ aee /
analyzed: a'a a'ara\/ aee /
translated: ā ā🔽

original: aoo ste 'di rnams la 'phel ba'i yi ge zhes bya'o //🔽aantya sva r'a dishti: mtha'i dbyangs la sogs pa ti'o //
analyzed: aoo ste 'di rnams la 'phel ba'i yi ge zhes bya'o // aantya sva r'a dishti: mtha'i dbyangs la sogs pa ti'o //
translated: These are called the augment letters.🔽The final vowel and so on are called ti.

original: mtha'i dbyangs la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams la ti'i ming can @12b zhes bya'o //🔽aanty'atp'u rba au pa dh'a /
analyzed: mtha'i dbyangs la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams la ti'i ming can @12b zhes bya'o // aanty'atp'u rba au pa dh'a /
translated: The letters of the final vowel and so on are called by the name ti.

original: mtha' las sngon ma au pa dh'a'o //
analyzed: mtha' las sngon ma au pa dh'a'o //
translated: The final is the first, and the upadhā.

original: mtha'i gsal byed srog med kyi sngon ma'i dbyangs de la au ba dh'a zhes ming du btags so //
analyzed: mtha'i gsal byed srog med kyi sngon ma'i dbyangs de la au ba dh'a zhes ming du btags so //
translated: The first vowel of the final consonant is called upadhā.

original: aa sam yo g'a di pa ro hra sva la ghu: pha rol tu yang dag par sbyor ba sogs med pa'i thung du ni yang ba'o //
analyzed: aa sam yo g'a di pa ro hra sva la ghu: pha rol tu yang dag par sbyor ba sogs med pa'i thung du ni yang ba'o //
translated: The short is light, without the asamyoga and so on, and the parāroha.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba dang / rnam bcad dang / rjes su nga ro rnams pha rol na yod pa dang ring po rnams ni lci ba yin la /🔽yang dag par sbyor ba sogs pha rol na med pa'i thung du rnams ni yang ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba dang / rnam bcad dang / rjes su nga ro rnams pha rol na yod pa dang ring po rnams ni lci ba yin la / yang dag par sbyor ba sogs pha rol na med pa'i thung du rnams ni yang ba'o //
translated: The short vowels are light.🔽The nasalized vowels are to be pronounced through both the mouth and the nose.

original: kha sna gnyis ka nas brjod dgos pa nya ma so sor bsdu ba rnams dang / gzhan yang yi ge mtha' dag la sna ldan gyi rigs kyang yod la /
analyzed: kha sna gnyis ka nas brjod dgos pa nya ma so sor bsdu ba rnams dang / gzhan yang yi ge mtha' dag la sna ldan gyi rigs kyang yod la /
translated: The other vowels are pronounced from the throat.🔽The sutra of Sarasvatī, the grammarian, says:🔽The vowels are light, the consonants are heavy.🔽The long vowels are heavy.🔽The short vowels are light.🔽The nasalized vowels are to be pronounced through both the mouth and the nose.

original: aa ku ha rnam bcad mgrin pa la skyes sogs kyang ngo //
analyzed: aa ku ha rnam bcad mgrin pa la skyes sogs kyang ngo //
translated: The other vowels are pronounced from the throat.

original: ai ti sva ra sva sti by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'a tsham dzny'a pra kri ya sa m'apt'a: zhes pa brda sprod pa dbyangs can gyi mdo las ming gi rab tu byed pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ai ti sva ra sva sti by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'a tsham dzny'a pra kri ya sa m'apt'a: zhes pa brda sprod pa dbyangs can gyi mdo las ming gi rab tu byed pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the section on names from the sutra of Sarasvatī, the grammarian.

original: // / de nas mtshams sbyor gyi cho ga rnams bshad par bya ste /🔽ai yam sva re /
analyzed: // / de nas mtshams sbyor gyi cho ga rnams bshad par bya ste / ai yam sva re /
translated: Now the connecting rituals will be explained.🔽The vowels are iyam svāḥ.

original: dbyangs la ai ya\'o //
analyzed: dbyangs la ai ya\'o //
translated: The vowels are iyam svāḥ.

original: pha rol tu dbyangs kyi yi ge gang rung zhig yod pa la tshu rol tshig mtha' la sogs pa'i ai yig ni ya\ ru 'gyur te /
analyzed: pha rol tu dbyangs kyi yi ge gang rung zhig yod pa la tshu rol tshig mtha' la sogs pa'i ai yig ni ya\ ru 'gyur te /
translated: If there is any vowel sign on the other side, the i vowel sign at the end of the word and so on becomes ya.

original: da dhi a'a na ya zhes pa bzhag / ai ya\/
analyzed: da dhi a'a na ya zhes pa bzhag / ai ya\/
translated: The i vowel sign is placed after da, dha, and a.

original: ha senyarhha sa: ha sa las ra ha ma yin pa'i ha sa rnams so //
analyzed: ha senyarhha sa: ha sa las ra ha ma yin pa'i ha sa rnams so //
translated: The ha sa is from ha, sa, ra, ha, sa.

original: dbyangs las pha rol gyi ra yig dang ha yig ma yin pa'i ha sa de ni ha sa'i yi ge pha rol la gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbyangs las pha rol gyi ra yig dang ha yig ma yin pa'i ha sa de ni ha sa'i yi ge pha rol la gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: That ha sa, which is not a ra or ha vowel sign on the other side of the vowel, becomes a ha sa vowel sign on the other side in two ways.

original: dha yig gnyis brjod /
analyzed: dha yig gnyis brjod /
translated: The dha is pronounced twice.

original: dzha bhe dza b'a: dzha bha la dza ba rnams so //
analyzed: dzha bhe dza b'a: dzha bha la dza ba rnams so //
translated: The ja bha is from ja, bha, ra, ha, sa.

original: tshu rol dzha sa'i yi ge rnams dzha bha so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge pha rol la dza ba so sor bsdu ba'i yi ger 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshu rol dzha sa'i yi ge rnams dzha bha so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge pha rol la dza ba so sor bsdu ba'i yi ger 'gyur te /
translated: The ja bha vowel signs on the other side of the ja sa vowel signs are the ja bha individual collection vowel signs on the other side.

original: dha yig gong ma sde pa gcig pa'i grangs mtshungs pa'i da yig tu bsgyur /
analyzed: dha yig gong ma sde pa gcig pa'i grangs mtshungs pa'i da yig tu bsgyur /
translated: The upper dha is changed to the corresponding da of the same group.

original: sva ra h'i nam pa re na sam yo dzyam /
analyzed: sva ra h'i nam pa re na sam yo dzyam /
translated: Svarahīnaṃ parayogaṃ samyag yojayet.

original: dbyangs kyis dman pa pha rol tu yang dag par sbyor ro //
analyzed: dbyangs kyis dman pa pha rol tu yang dag par sbyor ro //
translated: The inferior vowel is perfectly joined to the other side.

original: tshu rol gyi ha sa dbyangs med rnams pha rol dbyangs sam ha sa dbyangs ldan gang yod pa de la yang dag par sbyor te /
analyzed: tshu rol gyi ha sa dbyangs med rnams pha rol dbyangs sam ha sa dbyangs ldan gang yod pa de la yang dag par sbyor te /
translated: The hasas on the left side that do not have a vowel are joined to the vowel on the right side or to the hasa that has a vowel.

original: rim par drangs pas /
analyzed: rim par drangs pas /
translated: In order,

original: daddhy'a na ya/....(zho longs shig/) zhes pa grub /
analyzed: daddhy'a na ya/....(zho longs shig/) zhes pa grub /
translated: dadhyāna-ya,🔽go-rī-a-tra,

original: goo ri aa tra: zhes pa bzhag / ra\ yig gnyis su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: goo ri aa tra: zhes pa bzhag / ra\ yig gnyis su mi 'gyur /
translated: the two ra syllables do not change.

original: r'a dya bo dvi: ra las ya yang gnyis so //
analyzed: r'a dya bo dvi: ra las ya yang gnyis so //
translated: From ra, ya also is doubled.

original: dbyangs sngon na yod pa'i ra\ yig las @13a * //
analyzed: dbyangs sngon na yod pa'i ra\ yig las @13a * //
translated: From the ra syllable that has a vowel in front,

original: pha rol gyi ya yang gnyis su 'gyur bas /
analyzed: pha rol gyi ya yang gnyis su 'gyur bas /
translated: the ya on the right side is also doubled.

original: ya gnyis brjod /
analyzed: ya gnyis brjod /
translated: The two yas are expressed.

original: chu la ko ba'i rig pas re bas re pha steng du 'gro ste /
analyzed: chu la ko ba'i rig pas re bas re pha steng du 'gro ste /
translated: By the method of the skin on the water, the re becomes a pha above.

original: rim par drangs ra\ yig steng du bris /
analyzed: rim par drangs ra\ yig steng du bris /
translated: In order, the ra syllable is written above.

original: goo rya tra:....(dkar mo 'dir/) na hi: aa tra: zhes pa la /
analyzed: goo rya tra:....(dkar mo 'dir/) na hi: aa tra: zhes pa la /
translated: Go-rī-a-tra,🔽na-hi-a-tra,

original: na hya tra:....('dir med/) de bzhin du mdo gzhan gyis bsgrub dgos pa yod na yang /
analyzed: na hya tra:....('dir med/) de bzhin du mdo gzhan gyis bsgrub dgos pa yod na yang /
translated: in the same way, if there is a need to establish with another sūtra,

original: mdo de dag gzhung 'dir blangs te bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mdo de dag gzhung 'dir blangs te bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: those sūtras are taken in this text and must be established.

original: mdo gzhan rnams spong dgos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo gzhan rnams spong dgos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not necessary to reject the other sūtras.

original: au wam / auwa\'o //
analyzed: au wam / auwa\'o //
translated: Uvam. Uvo.

original: dbyangs pha rol la tshu rol gyi au yig ni wa\ yig tu bsgyur te /
analyzed: dbyangs pha rol la tshu rol gyi au yig ni wa\ yig tu bsgyur te /
translated: The u vowel of the other side is changed to the va consonant.

original: ma dhu aa tra: zhes pa la /
analyzed: ma dhu aa tra: zhes pa la /
translated: Madhu atra.

original: maddhva tra:....(sbrang rtsi 'dir/) ri ram /
analyzed: maddhva tra:....(sbrang rtsi 'dir/) ri ram /
translated: Madhvatra.

original: ri ra\'o // dbyangs pha rol la tshu rol gyi ri yig ni ra\ yig tu 'gyur te /🔽pi tri aartha: zhes pa la /
analyzed: ri ra\'o // dbyangs pha rol la tshu rol gyi ri yig ni ra\ yig tu 'gyur te / pi tri aartha: zhes pa la /
translated: The ri vowel of the other side is changed to the ra consonant.🔽Pitri artha.

original: pi trartha:....(pha'i don/) li lam /🔽li lam / li la\'o  //
analyzed: pi trartha:....(pha'i don/) li lam / li lam / li la\'o  //
translated: Pitrārtha.

original: dbyangs pha rol la tshu rol gyi li yig ni la\ yig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbyangs pha rol la tshu rol gyi li yig ni la\ yig tu 'gyur te /
translated: The li vowel of the other side is changed to the la consonant.

original: li aa nu bandha: la nu bandha:....(li yig rjes su 'brel pa/) ae aa ya\/
analyzed: li aa nu bandha: la nu bandha:....(li yig rjes su 'brel pa/) ae aa ya\/
translated: Lin anu bandha. Lanu bandha.🔽E ay.

original: ae aa ya\'o /
analyzed: ae aa ya\'o /
translated: E ay.

original: dbyangs pha rol la ae yig ni aa ya\ zhes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbyangs pha rol la ae yig ni aa ya\ zhes par 'gyur te /
translated: The e vowel of the other side is changed to the ay.

original: ne aa nam /
analyzed: ne aa nam /
translated: Ne anām.

original: na ya nam/....('dren byed de mig/) ao aa wa\/
analyzed: na ya nam/....('dren byed de mig/) ao aa wa\/
translated: Nayanām.🔽O av.

original: ao aa wa\'o //
analyzed: ao aa wa\'o //

analyzed: dbyangs pha rol la ao yig ni aawa\ zhes par 'gyur te /
translated: The o vowel of the other side is changed to the av.

original: bho aa ti /
analyzed: bho aa ti /
translated: Bho ati.

analyzed: bha ba ti/....(yod pa'am dngos po/) ....go la sogs pa'i pha rol tu aaksha: la sogs pa byung na bar du aa yig a'a ga ma brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: go aaksha: ga b'aksha:....(ba lang mig ste skar khung/) go aindra: ga bandra:....(ba lang gi dbang po ste khyu mchog/) go aa dzi nam /

original: bye ba sum cu rtsa drug 'jug / aakshoo hi n'i zhes par brjod/) na byanydza ne sva r'a sandhe y'a: gsal byed la dbyangs mtshams sbyor ba ma yin no //

translated: The thirty-six classes of the vowels and consonants are called the “akṣobhya” (imperturbable).

original: gsal byed pha rol la tshu rol gyi dbyangs rnams mtshams sbyor bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal byed pha rol la tshu rol gyi dbyangs rnams mtshams sbyor bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The consonants are not joined with the vowels.

original: yang / skabs la lar ya yig la dbyangs dang 'dra ba'i cho ga rnams lam gyi tshad brjod pa sogs dmigs bsal 'ga' zhig tu byed pa @13b yang yod de /
analyzed: yang / skabs la lar ya yig la dbyangs dang 'dra ba'i cho ga rnams lam gyi tshad brjod pa sogs dmigs bsal 'ga' zhig tu byed pa @13b yang yod de /
translated: In some cases, the vowel-like rules for the ya are used, such as in the expression of the distance of a path.

original: go yu ti: zhes pa la /
analyzed: go yu ti: zhes pa la /
translated: In goyuti,

original: ga byu ti:....(rgyang grags gnyis/) lam gyi tshad brjod pa sogs ma yin na bya ba med pas go yu ti:....(ba lang bsres pa/) nyid do //
analyzed: ga byu ti:....(rgyang grags gnyis/) lam gyi tshad brjod pa sogs ma yin na bya ba med pas go yu ti:....(ba lang bsres pa/) nyid do //
translated: if it is not an expression of the distance of a path, then because there is no action, it is goyuti.

original: aee a'a ya\/ aee a'a ya\'o //
analyzed: aee a'a ya\/ aee a'a ya\'o //
translated: Ai becomes āy.

original: dbyangs pha rol la aee yig ni a'a ya\ zhes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbyangs pha rol la aee yig ni a'a ya\ zhes par 'gyur te /
translated: The ai becomes āy.

original: nee aa ka: n'a ya ka:....(gtso bo/) aoo a'a wa /
analyzed: nee aa ka: n'a ya ka:....(gtso bo/) aoo a'a wa /
translated: Neiak, nāyak,

original: aoo a'a wa\'o //
analyzed: aoo a'a wa\'o //
translated: o becomes āv.

original: dbyangs pha rol la aoo yig ni a'a wa\ zhes bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbyangs pha rol la aoo yig ni a'a wa\ zhes bar 'gyur te /
translated: The vowel o becomes ā in the next syllable.

analyzed: too ai ha t'a bi ha/....(de dag 'di/) ybo rlo pa sha p'a pa d'ante / tshig mtha'i ya\ wa\ dag yang na dbyi'o // tshig mthar gnas pa'i aa ya\ la sogs pa rnams kyi ya\ yig dang wa\ yig dag yang na dbyi bar bya ste /
translated: to i ha ta vi ha🔽The ya and va at the end of words are also elided.

original: te a'a ga t'a: zhes pa la /🔽ta a'a ga t'a:....(de rnams tshur shog/) ....ta y'a ga t'a: ta smee a'a sa nam zhes ba la /
analyzed: te a'a ga t'a: zhes pa la / ta a'a ga t'a:....(de rnams tshur shog/) ....ta y'a ga t'a: ta smee a'a sa nam zhes ba la /

analyzed: tasm'a a'a sa nam/....(khyod la gdan/) ....tasm'a y'a sa nam / pa to ai ha zhes pa la /

analyzed: pa ta ai ha/....(mkhas pa 'di/) ....ba ta bi ha / aa soo aindra: zhes pa la /
translated: pāto 'ha🔽asau indraḥ

analyzed: aa s'a aindra:....('di dag dbang po) ....aa s'a bindra: spyir btang phyis pa la slar mtshams sbyor bya ba ma yin la /
translated: asau indraḥ

original: yang sdeb sbyor sogs kyi dgos pa yod na phyis pa las slar mtshams sbyor ba yod de /
analyzed: yang sdeb sbyor sogs kyi dgos pa yod na phyis pa las slar mtshams sbyor ba yod de /
translated: If there is a need for meter and so on, then there is a connection again after the elision.🔽In the phrase hesa khe iti,🔽he sa khe ti

analyzed: he sa khe ai ti zhes pa la /
translated: .🔽The final i and o are elided in the following of the a.🔽In te a tra

original: he sa khe ti/....(kye grogs po 'di/) ae do to& ta: aetra aotra dag las aatra'o //
analyzed: he sa khe ti/....(kye grogs po 'di/) ae do to& ta: aetra aotra dag las aatra'o //
translated: te a tra🔽.🔽The long vowel is for the combination of similar letters.

original: tshig mthar gnas pa'i ai yig dang ao yig las pha rol aa yig dbyi bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshig mthar gnas pa'i ai yig dang ao yig las pha rol aa yig dbyi bar bya ste /
translated: The long vowel is for the combination of similar letters after similar letters.

original: te aa tra: zhes pa la /
analyzed: te aa tra: zhes pa la /
translated: In the phrase shraddha a tra🔽shraddha a tra🔽.🔽The long vowel is for the combination of similar letters after similar letters.🔽In the phrase shraddha a tra🔽shraddha a tra🔽.🔽The long vowel is for the combination of similar letters after similar letters.

translated: Thus ends the Sandhi Samāsa of the Vyākaraṇa Sūtra of Sarasvatī.

original: // / de nas rnam bcad kyi mtshams sbyor rnams bshad par bya ste /🔽bi sardza n'i ya sya sa: rnam par bcad bya'i sra'o //
analyzed: // / de nas rnam bcad kyi mtshams sbyor rnams bshad par bya ste / bi sardza n'i ya sya sa: rnam par bcad bya'i sra'o //
translated: KA is the particle for the case of the ablative.🔽KṢA is the particle for the case of the ablative.🔽ŚA is the particle for the case of the genitive.

original: kha sa'i yi ge pha rol @16b la rnam bcad ni sra yig tu 'gyur te /🔽ka: ta no ti /
analyzed: kha sa'i yi ge pha rol @16b la rnam bcad ni sra yig tu 'gyur te / ka: ta no ti /
translated: ŚA is the particle for the case of the genitive.🔽The particle is also ŚA.🔽The particle is also ŚA.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the dative.

original: kasta no ti/....(gang 'thas par byed/) ka: tsa ra ti /
analyzed: kasta no ti/....(gang 'thas par byed/) ka: tsa ra ti /
translated: KṢA is the particle for the case of the dative.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the vocative.🔽KṢA is the particle for the case of the vocative.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the instrumental.

original: kashtsa ra ti/....(gang spyod par byed/) sha sha se b'a /
analyzed: kashtsa ra ti/....(gang spyod par byed/) sha sha se b'a /
translated: KṢA is the particle for the case of the instrumental.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the ablative.🔽KṢA is the particle for the case of the ablative.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the genitive.🔽KṢA is the particle for the case of the genitive.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the locative.

original: sha sha sa la yang na'o //
analyzed: sha sha sa la yang na'o //
translated: KṢA is the particle for the case of the locative.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the dative.

original: rnam bcad ni sha sha sa pha rol gyi gzugs su yang na 'gyur te /🔽ka: she te /
analyzed: rnam bcad ni sha sha sa pha rol gyi gzugs su yang na 'gyur te / ka: she te /
translated: KṢA is the particle for the case of the dative.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the vocative.🔽KṢA is the particle for the case of the vocative.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the instrumental.

original: kashshe te/....(su nyal/) ka: shande/....(dum bu gang byed/) kashsha nde /
analyzed: kashshe te/....(su nyal/) ka: shande/....(dum bu gang byed/) kashsha nde /
translated: KṢA is the particle for the case of the instrumental.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the ablative.🔽KṢA is the particle for the case of the ablative.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the genitive.🔽KṢA is the particle for the case of the genitive.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the locative.🔽KṢA is the particle for the case of the locative.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the dative.🔽KṢA is the particle for the case of the dative.🔽KA is the particle for the case of the vocative.🔽KṢA is the particle for the case of the vocative.

original: ka: s'adhu: (gang legs/) ....kass'a dhu: kuppo: qkanypoo  b'a /🔽ku pu dag la qka nypa dag yang na'o /
analyzed: ka: s'adhu: (gang legs/) ....kass'a dhu: kuppo: qkanypoo  b'a /🔽ku pu dag la qka nypa dag yang na'o /
translated: KA is the particle for the case of the instrumental.

original: rnam bcad ni ka sde dang ba sde'i yi ge kha sa'i nang tshan pha rol la rim pa bzhin qka dang nypa dag tu yang na 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam bcad ni ka sde dang ba sde'i yi ge kha sa'i nang tshan pha rol la rim pa bzhin qka dang nypa dag tu yang na 'gyur zhing /
translated: The exclusion is that the letters of the ka class and ba class, in the case of the class of kṣa, become qka and qnya, respectively.

original: ka dang pa ni brjod pa'i don te//🔽ka: ka ro ti /
analyzed: ka dang pa ni brjod pa'i don te// ka: ka ro ti /
translated: Ka and pa are the expressed meanings.🔽kaḥ = karoti🔽qkaḥ = karoti🔽kaḥ = khalu

original: kaqka ro ti/....(ci byed dam gang byed/) ....ka:ka ro ti /🔽ka:kha lu: kaqka lu:....(ngan pa gang/) ....ka: kha lu: ka: pa tha ti /
analyzed: kaqka ro ti/....(ci byed dam gang byed/) ....ka:ka ro ti / ka:kha lu: kaqka lu:....(ngan pa gang/) ....ka: kha lu: ka: pa tha ti /

original: kanypa  tha ti/....(gang klog par byed/) ....ka: pa tha ti /🔽ka:pha la ti /
analyzed: kanypa  tha ti/....(gang klog par byed/) ....ka: pa tha ti / ka:pha la ti /
translated: kaḥ = pathati🔽qkaḥ = pathati🔽kaḥ = phalati

original: kanypa  la ti/....(gang 'bras bu byed/) ....ka: pha la ti /
analyzed: kanypa  la ti/....(gang 'bras bu byed/) ....ka: pha la ti /
translated: qkaḥ = phalati

original: b'a tsa sya ba ty'a da ya: b'a tsa'i pa ti la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: b'a tsa sya ba ty'a da ya: b'a tsa'i pa ti la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: In the case of vatsasya vātāyām, vātīpātam, and so on.

original: b'a tsa:la sogs pa'i mtha' ni pa ti la sogs pa pha rol la ming gi sgra brjod pa la sa\ yig tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: b'a tsa:la sogs pa'i mtha' ni pa ti la sogs pa pha rol la ming gi sgra brjod pa la sa\ yig tu 'gyur la /
translated: The ending of vatsa and so on becomes sa in the expression of the name of the other, pāta and so on.

original: de yang ni p'a ta ste /
analyzed: de yang ni p'a ta ste /
translated: And that is pāta.

analyzed: b'a tsa: pa ti: p'a tsaspa ti:....(smra ba'i bdag po/) ba na: pa ti: ba naspa ti:....(nags bdag ste seng ge/) bri hatra ba ti: bri haspa ti:....(rigs byed bdag po ste phur bu/) k'a ra: ka ra: k'a raska ra:....(byed pa po/) p'a ra: ka ra: p'a raska ra:....(mchog gi
translated: Pāreścaraḥ, Pāreścaraḥ.🔽Tatkaraḥ, Tatkaraḥ.🔽Bhākaraḥ, Bhākaraḥ.🔽Hariścandraḥ, Hariścandraḥ.

original: byed pa po/) tata\ ka ra: taska ra:.... (chom rkun/) bh'a: ka ra: bh'aska ra:....('od byed de nyi ma/) ha ri tra tsandra: ha ri shtsandra:....('phrog byed zla ba 'am rgyal po seng ge zla ba/) 'di dag mtshon byed de /
analyzed: byed pa po/) tata\ ka ra: taska ra:.... (chom rkun/) bh'a: ka ra: bh'aska ra:....('od byed de nyi ma/) ha ri tra tsandra: ha ri shtsandra:....('phrog byed zla ba 'am rgyal po seng ge zla ba/) 'di dag mtshon byed de /
translated: These are the examples.

original: gzhan yang mdo gzhan nas bshad pa'i ni p'a ta rnams kyang de dag gi lugs bzhin du bya'o /🔽aahno ro r'a tri shu /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo gzhan nas bshad pa'i ni p'a ta rnams kyang de dag gi lugs bzhin du bya'o / aahno ro r'a tri shu /
translated: Moreover, the Nipaṭas explained in other sūtras should be done according to their system.🔽Ahanro rātri śu.

original: aa hanra gyi r'a tri ma yin pa la ra\'o //
analyzed: aa hanra gyi r'a tri ma yin pa la ra\'o //

analyzed: aa hana\ tshig tu grub pa'i mtha'i rnam bcad ni r'a tri la sogs pa'i pha rol ma yin pa la ra\ ru 'gyur te /

original: aa ha: pa ti: aa ha rpa ti:....(nyin mo'i bdag po ste nyi ma/) aa ha: ga na: aa harga na:....(nyin mo'i tshogs/) r'a tri sogs pa zhes pas r'a tri sogs la\ ra\ ru 'gyur ba ma yin te /

translated: The negation of the limit of the word a is a, and the negation of the limit of the other, rātri and so on, is r.🔽aham patih ahar patih

analyzed: aa ha: r'a tri: aa ho r'a tri:/....(nyin mtshan/) aa ha: r'u pam / aa ho r'u pam/....(nyin mo'i gzugs/) @17a * //

analyzed: aa to& tyu: aa las aa la au la /

analyzed: aa las pha rol gyi rnam bcad ni aa pha rol la au ru 'gyur te /

original: g'i: pa ti: g'irpa ti:....(smra ba'i bdag po/) g'iwpa  ti: dh'u: ba ti: dh'urpa ti:....(sa yi bdag po ste rgyal po 'am gnya' thag can te khyu mchog/) dh'unypa ti: ra: ra las so //

analyzed: ra yig las byung ba'i rnam bcad ni n'a mi ma yin kyang aa pa'i yi ge pha rol la ra\ ru 'gyur te /

original: pr'a t'a: @17b aa tra: pr'a t'a ratra:....(tho rangs 'dir/) aanta: ga ta: aantarga ta:....(nang du 'gro/) ri lo po d'irghashtsa /

original: ra la dbyi ste ring po yang ngo //
analyzed: ra la dbyi ste ring po yang ngo //
translated: The ra is elided, and it is also long.

original: ra\ yig ni ra yig pha rol la dbyi zhing /
analyzed: ra\ yig ni ra yig pha rol la dbyi zhing /
translated: The ra is elided on the other side of the ra.

original: dbyangs sngon ma 'ang ring por 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbyangs sngon ma 'ang ring por 'gyur te /
translated: The vowel before it also becomes long.

original: pu na: r'a ma te /
analyzed: pu na: r'a ma te /

original: pu n'a r'a ma te/....(slar yang rtsed me byed/) shu kti: r'u py'atma n'a bh'a ti /
analyzed: pu n'a r'a ma te/....(slar yang rtsed me byed/) shu kti: r'u py'atma n'a bh'a ti /

original: shukt'i r'u py'atma n'a bh'a ti/....(nya phyis dngul du bdag nyid sems so//) see sh'addha se /
analyzed: shukt'i r'u py'atma n'a bh'a ti/....(nya phyis dngul du bdag nyid sems so//) see sh'addha se /

original: sa dang ae sha las ha sa la'o //
analyzed: sa dang ae sha las ha sa la'o //

original: sa'i sgra dang ae sha'i sgra las pha rol gyi rnam bcad ni ha sa pha rol la dbyi bar bya ste /🔽sa: tsara ti /
analyzed: sa'i sgra dang ae sha'i sgra las pha rol gyi rnam bcad ni ha sa pha rol la dbyi bar bya ste / sa: tsara ti /
translated: From the word sa and the word eṣa, the exclusion of the other is elided in hāsya.🔽Saḥ carati.🔽Saḥ carati.🔽Eṣa hasati.

original: sa tsa ra ti/....(de 'gro 'am de spyod par byed dam de g-yo bar byed/) ae sha: ha sa ti /
analyzed: sa tsa ra ti/....(de 'gro 'am de spyod par byed dam de g-yo bar byed/) ae sha: ha sa ti /
translated: Eṣa hasati.

original: ae sha ha sa ti/....('di dgod par byed/) see sha d'a sha ra th'i r'a ma: see sha r'a dza yu dhi shth'i ra:/
analyzed: ae sha ha sa ti/....('di dgod par byed/) see sha d'a sha ra th'i r'a ma: see sha r'a dza yu dhi shth'i ra:/
translated: Seṣā daśarathairamaḥ, seṣā rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ,

original: see sha karna ma h'a ty'a g'i see sha bh'i mo ma h'a ba la:/
analyzed: see sha karna ma h'a ty'a g'i see sha bh'i mo ma h'a ba la:/
translated: seṣaḥ karṇo mahātyāgī, seṣo bhīmo mahābalaḥ.

original: de 'di shing rta bcu pa'i bu dga' byed //
analyzed: de 'di shing rta bcu pa'i bu dga' byed //

original: de 'di rgyal po g-yul ngor brtan pa'o /
analyzed: de 'di rgyal po g-yul ngor brtan pa'o /
translated: He is this king Yudhiṣṭhira.

original: de 'di gtong ba chen po rna ba can //
analyzed: de 'di gtong ba chen po rna ba can //
translated: He is this Karṇa, the great giver.

original: de 'di 'jigs pa stobs ni chen po'o //
analyzed: de 'di 'jigs pa stobs ni chen po'o //

translated: kṛṣṇāya, kṛṣṇābhyām, kṛṣṇebhyaḥ.

original: kroshtu bhya: drug pa'i gcig tshig dang gnyis tshig la /
analyzed: kroshtu bhya: drug pa'i gcig tshig dang gnyis tshig la /
translated: The sixth case has singular and dual forms:🔽kṛṣṇāya, kṛṣṇābhyām, kṛṣṇābhyām, kṛṣṇebhyaḥ, kṛṣṇebhyaḥ.

original: kroshtu:...(ngasa\/) kroshtu:...(ngasa\/) kroshtro:...(aosa\/) kroshtvo:...(aosa\/) drug pa'i mang tshig la /
analyzed: kroshtu:...(ngasa\/) kroshtu:...(ngasa\/) kroshtro:...(aosa\/) kroshtvo:...(aosa\/) drug pa'i mang tshig la /
translated: The plural form is:🔽kṛtākriyaprasamgīyovidhi sa niyatyaḥ.

original: kri t'a kri ta pra sam g'i yo bi dhi sa ni tya:/
analyzed: kri t'a kri ta pra sam g'i yo bi dhi sa ni tya:/
translated: Nityānityayor nityavidhir balavan.

original: ni ty'a ni tya yo rni tya bi dhi rbal banta: byed dang mi byed kun tu brjod pa yi //
analyzed: ni ty'a ni tya yo rni tya bi dhi rbal banta: byed dang mi byed kun tu brjod pa yi //
translated: The ritual of that which is both done and not done is always mentioned.

original: gang de'i @25b cho ga rab tu nges pa ni //
analyzed: gang de'i @25b cho ga rab tu nges pa ni //
translated: That ritual is definite.

original: rtag ba dang ni mi rtag pa dag gi //
analyzed: rtag ba dang ni mi rtag pa dag gi //
translated: It is permanent and impermanent.

original: rtag pa'i cho ga stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i cho ga stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The permanent ritual is powerful.

original: de yang au mtha'i bya ba ni rtag pa'i cho ga dang ri mtha'i cho ga ni mi rtag pa bcos ma'i cho ga yin pas rtag tu rtag pa'i cho ga stobs che bas drug pa'i mang tshig la au mtha'i cho ga kho na bya ste /
analyzed: de yang au mtha'i bya ba ni rtag pa'i cho ga dang ri mtha'i cho ga ni mi rtag pa bcos ma'i cho ga yin pas rtag tu rtag pa'i cho ga stobs che bas drug pa'i mang tshig la au mtha'i cho ga kho na bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the suffix -um is the sign of permanence and the suffix -ri is the sign of impermanence, the sign of fabrication. Therefore, since the sign of permanence is always stronger, the plural of the sixth case takes only the suffix -um.

original: krosht'u n'am/...(a'ama\/) bdun pa gsum la /
analyzed: krosht'u n'am/...(a'ama\/) bdun pa gsum la /
translated: The three of the seventh case are:🔽kroshtāṇam, kroshtāro, kroshtāḥ.

original: kroshta ri/...(ngi/) kroshtroo/...(nge/)  kroshtro:...(aosa/) kroshtvo: ...(aosma\/) kroshtu shu/...(suba\/) bod tshig gsum la /
analyzed: kroshta ri/...(ngi/) kroshtroo/...(nge/)  kroshtro:...(aosa/) kroshtvo: ...(aosma\/) kroshtu shu/...(suba\/) bod tshig gsum la /
translated: The three Tibetan words are:

original: he kroshto / ...(si/) he kroshta roo /
analyzed: he kroshto / ...(si/) he kroshta roo /
translated: he kroshtā, he kroshtāro, he kroshtāḥ.

original: he kroshta ra: de rnams kyi skyes pa'i rtags ri yig mtha' can rnams so /
analyzed: he kroshta ra: de rnams kyi skyes pa'i rtags ri yig mtha' can rnams so /
translated: The signs of the masculine are those ending in the letter ri.

original: // / r'i yig dang li yig dang ae yig rnams kyi mtha' can ni rab tu ma grub bo//
analyzed: // / r'i yig dang li yig dang ae yig rnams kyi mtha' can ni rab tu ma grub bo//
translated: Those ending in the letters ra, la, and e are not well established.

original: ` skyes pa'i rtags aee yig mtha' can las su ree'i zhes pa'i sgra la mtshon na /
analyzed: ` skyes pa'i rtags aee yig mtha' can las su ree'i zhes pa'i sgra la mtshon na /
translated: From the sign of the masculine ending in the letter ai, the word surai is illustrated.

original: dang po'i gcig tshig la /
analyzed: dang po'i gcig tshig la /
translated: In the singular of the first case,

original: ree sbhi / ree'i sa dang bha la'o //🔽ree lta bu'i aee yig mtha' ni rnam dbye sa yig dang bha yig dang po rnams pha rol la a'a yig tu 'gyur te /

translated: Raibhya, Raibhas, and Balah.🔽The final ai of Raibhya becomes ā before the first syllables of the case endings sa and bha.

original: ` su r'a: ....(nor can/) dbyangs thog ma can thams cad la a'aya\ ru bsgyur bas gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /🔽su r'a yoo/...(aoo/) su r'a ya:...(dzasa\/) gnyis pa gsum la ;

analyzed: dang po'i mang tshig la /

analyzed: ra yig mtha' can grangs kyi don dang 'brel ba las rnam dbye a'ama\ la nu ta\ a'a ga ma 'gyur te /

original: nuta ra las ya yang zhes pa'i /
analyzed: nuta ra las ya yang zhes pa'i /

analyzed: na yig mtha' can las r'a dzanra zhes pa'i sgra la /

original: r'a dznya:...(ngasa\) r'a dznyo:...(aosa\) r'a dzny'am/...(a'ama\) bdun pa'i gcig tshig la /🔽ai ngi dag la yang na 'os /

original: ` de bzhin du /

analyzed: shas la sogs pa dbyangs la ma ba zhes pas ma yig dang ba yig brtsegs pa rnams la aa mi dbyi ste /

analyzed: ` shu na:....(shasa\) shu n'a /

analyzed: 'dra ba'i yi ge 'dus pa la ring po 'os /

analyzed: ` y'u na:...(shasa\) y'u n'a/...(t'a) sogs so //

analyzed: ma gha ban la'ang ba au /

original: au la ao 'os /
analyzed: au la ao 'os /

analyzed: ` ma gho na: ...(shasa\) ma gho n'a/...(t'a) ma gha ba bhy'am /

analyzed: ma gha ba bhi: sogs so /

original: ` / na yig mtha' can pa thinra zhes pa'i sgra la'ang khyad par yod de /
